title: AR-Based Inquiry Learning: Advanced Biology Concepts Course

context.prior_knowledge: Mastery of high school biology fundamentals and basic smartphone/tablet operation skills
context.additional_context: Constructing a visualization-based inquiry learning environment using AR technology, combining weekly face-to-face sessions with asynchronous online activities

learning_goals: AR simulation tools can be utilized to analyze the cell division process in 3D and explain key stages.

Learners can analyze three cases applying AR technology (3D modeling, augmented reality simulations) to biological phenomena (e.g., cell division, ecosystem interactions) and write a report including two improvement plans based on educational effectiveness criteria (engagement, comprehension enhancement).
Collaborative inquiry activities enhance the ability to design AR-based experiments and interpret data.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
